definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The department of residence register ought to bear mostly liability in controlling repetition of names.
sentences.chinese: 戶籍登記機關在控制重名重姓方面應當負主要責任。

sentences.english: These are two files with the same name, but the older one is slightly larger.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個重名的文件，只是老文件更大些。

sentences.english: The problem of a single name for several persons is avoided but can not be eliminated in the person-naming.
sentences.chinese: 重名是人名命名中一個儘量避免而又無法消除的問題。

sentences.english: There are too many namesakes , causing great difficulty to administration of residential registration.
sentences.chinese: 重名太多，給戶籍管理帶來了很大的困難。

definition: having same given name and family name
two-character surname such as 司馬|司马 or 諸葛|诸葛
name (of a person or thing)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to name/to christen/to take a name
literary name (an alternative name of a person stressing a moral principle)/courtesy name
five hundred years ago we were the same family (idiom) (said of persons with the same surname)
pinyin: wu3 bai3 nian2 qian2 shi4 yi1 jia1
